citations.narrative:
From 10:45AM to 11:00AM USDA personnel observed approximately 100 visitors pet and feed animals in the petting zoo
including goats, alpacas, a zebra, and other domestic and exotic hoof stock. The public was able to reach over and
through wire fencing to have contact with the animals. For the majority of the time, an employee/attendant was not
present in the area. Two employees were later observed but they were working in the prairie dog exhibit, which is located
at one end of the large petting zoo. These employees were focused on a project in the prairie dog enclosure and were not
observing or supervising customers or animals in the petting zoo.
When members of the public have contact with domestic and wild/exotic animals, supervision is important to ensure
safety of animals and the public.
Correct by ensuring that a responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable employee or attendant is present at all
times during periods of public contact with animals. CORRECT BY: November 3rd, 2023.

According to the Safari Park Manager and disposition records, on the morning of October 18, 2023 two healthy adult
rheas were found deceased, and the condition of the carcasses was consistent with death by predation (much of the
carcasses were missing/eaten). Holes were found dug under the enclosure fencing (wire deer fencing) that were
consistent with coyotes entering the enclosure. The facility worked with wildlife professionals and undertook aggressive
predator abatement measures over the next few weeks, during which time coyotes were seen by the Safari Park
Manager. The holes under the fencing were also repaired. Since that time, no further animals have been lost to predation.
The facility has also implemented a proactive program of predator detection and abatement.
Animals that are not protected from predators may experience stress, pain, injury and death.
Correct by ensuring that enclosures are maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and contain the
animals. Corrected at the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
